spell.name: Nerve Gas
entries: You create a 10-foot-radius sphere of toxic fog centered on a point you choose within range. The fog spreads around corners. It lasts for the duration or until strong wind disperses the fog, ending the spell. The fog's area is heavily obscured.

When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes {@damage 3d6} psychic damage and becomes {@condition stunned} until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}. Creatures are affected even if they hold their breath or don't need to breathe.

components.m: samples of phosphate and chlorine mixed with a drop of pure alcohol

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the acid damage increases by {@dice 1d6} psychic damage for each slot level above 5th.
